title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 39.4 - Compliance with competitive bidding statutes or other applicable provisions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 39.4 - Compliance with competitive bidding statutes or other applicable provisions

State Regulations

No political subdivision shall enter into an installment
purchase contract unless and until it has complied with the competitive bidding
requirements of article 5-A of the General Municipal Law or of any other
general, special or local law. If no such competitive bidding requirements are
applicable, the political subdivision shall comply with its procurement
policies and procedures adopted pursuant to General Municipal Law, section
104-b. F or purposes of complying with such requirements or procedures, a
political subdivision may determine to solicit bids, quotations or proposals, as the case may be, in the alternative, exclusive and inclusive, of the cost of
financing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
39.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
